text: HubDB - You can Use hubDB to manage all of the content for the megamenu. Use the Navigation menu to create the structure for the megamenu but then use hubDB for the actual content. You can key it all off of the URL for each link if you want. Then you can have fields for links / content / images / icons etc.  - I just finished a build like this a few months back and it worked really well. And is “easy” to edit later on. But the hubDB table can get a little bit cumbersome
`{% choice "board", label="Choose board", value="Association", choices="Association, Education, Insurance, Services, WCT", export_to_template_context=True %}` any idea why that would cause:
Seeing some of this with a textarea field this morning as well.
Editing team rolled back some changes. Can you verify now <@UJ3G9FH9U> and <@U010F27NS6L>?

Hi everyone, I have a form on an hubdb page using the hubl form tag.
`{% form "studies_and_reports_form",` 
   `form_to_use='{{ dynamic_page_hubdb_row.form_id }}',` 
   `follow_up_type_simple="true",` 
   `simple_email_for_live_id="{{ dynamic_page_hubdb_row.follow-up_email_id }}",`
   `response_redirect_url="{{ dynamic_page_hubdb_row.form_ty_page_url }}"`
`%}`
The form is there and the redirection works. The follow up email is not sending though, and I don't see why. Does anyone have a clue as to why the email is not following up the form submission?
